intro: Pyxidaria ellobum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pyxidaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
